caption: Best slice in SF!!

I love this spot! They serve superb dishes, they have a rich menu, The cook in that restaurant is well trained, I enjoy a lot eating all their food. The dishes are consistently fresh, the service towards the customers  is very good too. I frequently visit this restaurant and I not even once was discontended.  I highly recommend it.
Decent pizza but the sides seemed a bit lacking. Also a little expensive for what you get.
Definitely a spot worth stopping by, the food is fantastic and fresh, the costs are convenient and it is regularly clean there. Keep up the good work.
I had the best pizza of my life at that time. Since then I have visited this place numerous times and my opinion about this pizza has still not changed.
Love the Arugula and Avocado Salad, the chicken parm and the wings but THE CANOLI THO!

When in Rome!  Visit GIOIA in Hayes for a slice or a pie...either way you won't regret it.  The staff was incredibly helpful and suggested I get the best of both world.  Cuz sometimes, you CAN have your cake and eat it too.  Ciao!
Meh. There are better pizza places all over the city.
Amazing ppl ingredients need more fresh pies hot rdy to go!

Had the chicken parmigian sandwich. Portion is good size. Breading on the chicken was super mushy and fell apart while trying to eat. Overall the taste was lacking, the one word that kept coming to me was bland. Sauce was bland, chicken was …
Great shatteringly crispy foldable slice house. Great ingredients, excellent value!

This spot is legit for a slice of pizza. The crust is perfectly thin and nicely charred. The flavor of the cheese is amazing and the pepperoni is great as well. However, my favorite was this broccolini slice. The ricotta was super flavorful …

Hands down some of the best pizza in the city, the dough is amazing.  It’s pretty tricky to make a cheese-less pizza that isn’t soggy but Gioia does this perfectly!! Any of their pizzas are amazing with/without cheese (for all my fellow lactose intolerant/vegans).

Decent pizza, honestly just go here because Paxti's is not real pizza and this is the closest place. Also, they don't let you add pepperoni to a pizza (specifically pepperoni, you can add other things).  Missed upsell opportunity.  I literally asked if I could just pay for it and they said they don't do that.

Highly recommending Gioia Pizzeria to people who are fans of New York style pizza using super fresh ingredients.  The overall quality of the food was amazing!  I thought the pizza was fabulous and my son thought it was the best pizza he has …
The pizza is delicious and their meatball sandwich is to die for. Hope they get all the support and business they need during covid to stay strong, love this place!
Refuse to add extra sauce to a pizza, their pizza is good but occasionally extremely dry. Za or Emilia’s are way better and are willing to customize unlike the arrogant folks over at gioia.
Best pizza hands down! My all time favorite now! And the canolis are phenomenal as well!
The most rede stuff with DoorDash drivers always like that ..... 🤢

This is my go-to place for a single slice of divinely crispy thin crust pizza that is a bit elevated. Not your cheap greasy-spoon kinda place, this spot is a bit fancy pants in its execution and has really friendly great staff. The wings …
Old review - We were skeptic so first just got two slices, and boy was it great! Ordered the whole pizza next :)

Ever had a slice of pizza that reminds you of Jon Stewart's rant on pizza? These do! Made just right for folding and biting into. Really knocked it out the park with the avocado + arugula salad and chicken wings, too. You can taste and see …
Love the pizza, but the wings are the s--t, period nuff said....
Tried to order takeout. The staff seems very clueless and mixes up orders. Never received mine and ended up cancelling after 30 minutes waiting.
Two Sisters pizza is more than decent.  It’s become one of my favorite pies in the city.  Order something on menu because the additions are ludicrously priced.  Hence the omission of a fifth star.

$30 for a 18” pie. One Topping Pepperoni. Burnt curst. Received it hard, cold and old. I don’t know why these PLAIN tasting pizzas cost so much. Got ripped off but lesson learned and on the “no go restaurant” list. Only thing good are the salads and desserts.
Amazing NY pepp slice, and good combo pies. Absolutely can’t go wrong with this place, the neighb needed a slice spot really bad and these guys crush it.

Absolute!! Pizza Margherita was my choice. I loved sweet cherry tomatoes browned nicely, flavorful cheese and the pizza sauce with a little kick!! I eat from the outer crust which is tasty by itself. Best and only pizzeria I will go.
Delicious slice on a crispy crust and the staff is always so kind!
Very disappointed 😞
In San Francisco the  cashiers staffs are so bad. I asked her every 15 minutes and she all the time rude saying that I need wait. After 60 minutes waiting she said that doesn t have my order. Mess.

This place is annoying. They are habitually slow and they literally don't care. I forgot about this place and took the order. They left out items and were slow. I'll remember next time. If you go be prepared to wait, wait and yes, wait. Make sure all your items are in the bag.

Ordered gioia’s via doordash on a Friday at 7pm. Usually not a good idea. 50 mins later, I call gioia’s to ask about the order and they say it’s been sitting, waiting to be picked up for 30 mins now. Doordash reluctantly sends another …

This site is my number one place.  Of all restaurants I know I favor it most. I never miss an opportunity to go to visit this restaurant. everytime  I want to go to a fair lunch, this place comes first to my mind.  Great and all kinds of …
Pizzas good, but the new ordering process is pretty chaotic now
delicious pizza
New York style in Hayes Valley... great spot!

Half a year ago this pizza was great. Now the same is happening as it happened to Tony Napolitana: it's not made with love anymore, its just a fatty, salty piece of something. That probably just happens if you think you made it... and then …
Great slices!

They wrongly gave meat in our food. When confronted on phone, they asked us to come back in person. On going back, they asked us to show us the pizza to confirm for themselves. They made a new one only after visually examining and …

I purchased from Gioia Pizzeria for the first time and it was a great experience. With San Francisco being under a “shelter-in-place,” order, I wanted to support a local business, especially when I was craving pizza. Let me start from the …
Really great pizza - veggieful and fresh - and just about the only $5 bite to eat in Hayes Valley

my favorite pizza place! No slice can compare to that of Gioia's Julian. Customer service is pretty lacking. Sometimes I get a cool cashier, or I get one that doesn't ask for here or to go and the gentleman handling the pizza has to huff …
The best!
The best New York style pizza I've found in SF!

Service was ok.  I somewhat regret tipping.  The pizza was delicious but price is average for its quality.  Salad was pre-made with all of the ingredients separated.  Honestly, nothing attracts me to return this place.
Some of the best pizza in the bay. Favorites are the Julian and Salcicia

Gioia's is probably the best slice I've had in my 20 years in the bay area. It's not new york style or any other style -- to me it's a thin crust style of it's own. I think of it most days and try to eat it at least once per week because we only live once and might as well live well
Might be the best pizza I've had in sf! Really interesting flavor combinations! Great service!
Must be some kind of joke to ask 10$ for caesar salad that looks like this. Suggest to remove it from your menu. Not happy at all. M.
Awesome pizza, long lines but worth it.

Worst customer service I've had in a long time. Can I do the half and half on the pie? No just buy slices which is more expensive. Opted for just one flavor and at $33.25 for a pizza that was good but not great. Don't get the hype!! Only 2 tables.
Patxi and Tony are much better. Spics
Good pizza and good meatball parm sandwich,  though you need a knife and fork to eat it!
good thin pizza
Pizza with a side of meatballs were delicious, server very friendly & accommodating to our party of 4
It's the best pizza I've had in SF. Sorry Tony. You good, but not this good.

Gioia, for me, shares the crown with Tony’s/Slice House for best pizza in SF. And yes I’ve tried Arinell’s, Emilio’s, you name it.  A few things help it stand out: 1) The crust is well seasoned and has a bit of char to it. Good texture. It …

Great slice spot in Hayes Valley. They've got really good topping combinations and yummy sandwiches. Not a ton of seating but close to a park area where you can take your slice and lots of seating and benches on the street.
Best NY pizza in these parts 🔥🔥 Great pickup times, great employees, and they sell by the slice. Go. Now.
Really great pizza flavors and awesome service
Pretty tasty and relatively cheap pizza
I stopped by for a couple slices and seriously regret not going back for a full pizza. I think about this place more than I care to admit. Would highly highly recommend.
So good that's all I got to say about that

caption: No gluten free options! Unacceptable in this neighborhood. You’re losing lots of business.
Yummy but super expensive
Gat-damn these were good. Meatball farm sandwich and slice of saliccia.
Best slices in Hayes!
The BEST pizza in San Francisco imo. Took me back to NYC...might be the best NY slice I’ve had outside of nyc. Grab a slice or a pie and sit by the window. Crumb, crust, fresh ingredients...yum.
My top place for Pizza. Great hospitality. I look forward to a return visit. The bill was fair for the quality of the food.
Meatballs sandwich was fantastic
Pizza done a little different at fair prices.
Dang fine slice.
Excellent pizza and delicious cannoli!!
Cute small pizaria with amazing pizza! We only got two slices but they were both awsome. They warmed it up for us too even though we were bringing it home to eat.
Great pizza!
(Translated by Google) Magnificent very special place  (Original) Magnifico el lugar muy especial
Good pizza
Great pie. Top 3 NY style in San Francisco. Mostly by slice with about 10 seats. Stays busy so there is always a hot pie coming out of the oven.
Better order a whole pizza. You'll get it done freshly. Very nice for a take out eat.
Very tasty pizza.
I'm not impressed by this place.. nothing special and pizza is ok..

The pies deserve 5 stars solely from a taste perspective. But Gioia loses a star due to its prices - the place is rather pricey, with the price of a whole pie coming in at more than all or nearly all of Gioia's local competitors. They lose …
Great pizza by the slice!! Good fairly traditional flavor combos and quick easy service
Pizza was delicious and staff was super friendly. Great delicious slices but on the pricey side. Normal for SF but worth a visit!
Pizza by the slice ok.  Can be very busy, and only small space for eating inside.
Fast service and decent slices
Finally a decent slice shop in SF. Just got back from a Ny trip and happy to finally have a slice like this at home 😁
well the pizzeria is very good has a good staff help fast and x sierto the pizzas these delicious very rich and are hijienicos

I didn’t think I had posted this yet - oops! Anyway, I love Gioia Pizzeria. Been there twice already. I love the pizza, of course. Lived in NYC 6 years and NYC-style, thin crust pizza is the ONLY pizza and Gioia does it RIGHT. It’s hard to …
OMG ❤️. Six years after relocating from NYC, I've finally tasted pizza like home. Delicious.
Excellent crust. Would return when Im in the area.
Excellent thin crust pizza! I've only tried the formaggio, but you can tell they use high quality ingredients. A bit on the pricey side, but not crazy for San Francisco.
Ex New Yorkers- look no further to find your beloved NY slice! It’s your favorite bk slice with gourmet toppings!
Yummy and quick NY style pizza
The best New York style pizza in San Francisco.
We tried 3 different pizza slices and they we're all unique and excellent!
